details.publicNotes:
Attendants are servants of Lissala, the Azlanti deity of obedience and rewards through service. Each attendant represents the ways in which loyal service might be rewarded by Lissala, and some attendants began existence as mortal servants who earned the blessing of divine transformation through their obedience in life. Kurshudis represent the reward of eternal life in service. A kurshudi punishes those who try to shirk their fates or use magic to manipulate events that should occur. They pride themselves on handing out proclamations in combat, casting magic, wielding a divinely enchanted rocket launcher, and regularly following up with sanctions against their targets.

Kurshu The Undying

Once a herald of Lissala, Kurshu was defeated by a group of adventurers on Lost Golarion in ages past. Lissala created the kurshudi attendants in her slain herald's image and named them in her honor. In this way, Kurshu's loyalty was rewarded and her legacy persists through eternity.

publication.title: Starfinder Second Edition Playtest Adventure: Empires Devoured

description.value:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the kurshudi uses a fortune effect that allows for a reroll

Effect The kurshudi can select which of the rolled dice is used for the result, even if the creature's ability allows it to select a rerolled result. If this effect causes a target's roll to critically fail, then the kurshudi becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} 1 for 1 minute.

You psychically grasp a creature's throat or other vital anatomy with a vicelike grip, forcefully lifting it a few inches off the ground as it struggles to breathe. Make a ranged spell attack against the target's AC. On a hit, you deal 6d12 bludgeoning damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. The target takes 1d12 persistent bludgeoning damage, remains immobilized and must continue holding its breath for each round you Sustain the Spell. While immobilized in this way, it must hold its breath or begin suffocating. The target can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} (the escape DC is your spell DC and the escape attempt is affected by the incapacitation trait).

You see through most materials and walls within 60 feet. Your sight is blocked by 2 feet of wood or plastic, 1 foot of stone, 2 inches of common metal, or any amount of lead or any starmetal, and you can only see in black and white.

Divine flames scour creatures within the area. Creatures take 6d6 fire damage and @Damage[(@item.level -3)d6[persistent,fire]] damage. The divine power within the flames scorches the spirit as well; a creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage from divine immolation if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM).

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and no persistent damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and persistent damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and double persistent damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6 and persistent damage increases by 1d6.

You create an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, floating eye, 1 inch in diameter, at a location you can see within 500 feet. It sees in all directions with your normal visual senses and continuously transmits what it sees to you.

The first time you Sustain the spell each round, you can either move the eye up to 30 feet, seeing only things in front of the eye, or move it up to 10 feet, seeing everything in all directions around it. There is no limit to how far from you the eye can move, but the spell ends immediately if you and the eye ever cease to be on the same plane of existence. You can attempt Seek actions through the eye if you want to attempt Perception checks with it. Any damage dealt to the eye destroys it and ends the spell.

You inflict despair on creatures in the area. The effects for each creature are determined by its Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the creature can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is automatically slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Heightened (7th) The area increases to a 60-foot cone.

You channel the fury of divinity against your foes. You deal 4d10 spirit damage to enemies in the area, depending on their Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}; while it's sickened, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher rank than the unfettered movement spell.

You burden a creature with all the aches, pains, and sorrows of a lifetime in a condensed bolt. Make a ranged spell attack roll. The bolt deals 6d8 mental damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.

Critical Success target takes 12d8 damage and is encumbered for 1 minute.

Success The target takes 6d8 damage and is encumbered for 1 round.

The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.

Requirements The kurshudi's last action this round was to cast a spell

Effect The kurshudi chooses one target affected by the cast spell that failed its save or that the kurshudi successfully hit with a spell attack roll. That target takes an additional @Damage[1d10[persistent,mental]] damage and the kurshudi attempts to Demoralizes them using the spell's range. When it does, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and the kurshudi does not take a penalty if the target doesn't understand their language.

Requirements The kurshudi's last action this round was an Area Fire with its rocket launcher

Effect The kurshudi chooses one target affected by the Area Fire that failed its save. That target takes an additional @Damage[1d10[persistent,fire]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} as long as the persistent damage continues.

The kurshudi manifests ammo for this rocket launcher through faith, and never needs to reload. A creature that critically fails its save against Area Fire from this rocket launcher also takes @Damage[1d10[persistent,spirit]] damage.
